# Recipe: Instapot Sausage and Peppers

- [Ingredients](#ingredients)

- [Cooking Time](#cooking-time)

- [Storage and Leftovers](#storage-and-leftovers)
- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)

## Introduction
Instapot Sausage and Peppers is a delicious and flavorful dish that combines Italian sausage, bell peppers, onions, and a savory tomato sauce. This classic Italian-American dish is known for its simplicity and bold flavors. It can be served on its own, over pasta, or in a sandwich.

## Ingredients
- 4 Italian sausages (sweet or spicy)
- 2 bell peppers (any color), sliced
- 1 onion, sliced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
- 1 can (6 oz) tomato paste
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional, for heat)
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- Olive oil, for cooking

## Equipment
- Instant Pot or pressure cooker
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Wooden spoon or spatula

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 25 minutes (including pressure build-up and release time)

## Steps
1. Set the Instant Pot to sauté mode and add a drizzle of olive oil.
2. Once the oil is hot, add the sausages and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the sausages from the Instant Pot and set aside.
3. In the same Instant Pot, add the sliced bell peppers, onion, and minced garlic. Sauté for a few minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
4. Add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, dried oregano, dried basil, red pepper flakes (if using), salt, and pepper to the Instant Pot. Stir well to combine.
5. Return the browned sausages to the Instant Pot, nestling them into the sauce and vegetables.
6. Close the Instant Pot lid and set the valve to the sealing position.
7. Select the "Pressure Cook" or "Manual" setting and set the cooking time to 10 minutes on high pressure.
8. Once the cooking time is complete, allow for a natural pressure release for 5 minutes, then carefully switch the valve to the venting position to release any remaining pressure.
9. Open the Instant Pot lid and remove the sausages. Slice them into bite-sized pieces.
10. Using a wooden spoon or spatula, gently break apart any large chunks of bell peppers or onions.
11. Serve the sausage and peppers over pasta, rice, or in a sandwich. Spoon some of the tomato sauce over the top.
12. Enjoy!

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Instapot Sausage and Peppers over cooked pasta, such as penne or spaghetti, for a hearty meal.
- Alternatively, you can serve it over steamed rice or with crusty bread for a filling and satisfying dinner.
- Top with grated Parmesan cheese and fresh basil for an extra burst of flavor.

## Variations
- For a spicier version, use hot Italian sausages or add extra red pepper flakes.
- Add sliced mushrooms or zucchini to the dish for additional vegetables.
- Experiment with different types of sausages, such as chicken or turkey sausage, to suit your taste preferences.

## Tips and Tricks
- Browning the sausages before pressure cooking adds extra flavor and texture to the dish.
- If you prefer a thicker sauce, you can add a cornstarch slurry (cornstarch mixed with water) to the Instant Pot after cooking and simmer for a few minutes until the sauce thickens.
- Adjust the seasoning according to your taste. You can add more dried herbs, garlic, or spices to enhance the flavors.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional information for Instapot Sausage and Peppers will vary depending on the type and quantity of sausages used. Here is an approximate breakdown per serving (based on 4 servings):
  - Calories: 350
  - Fat: 25g
  - Carbohydrates: 15g
  - Protein: 18g
  - Fiber: 4g
  - Sugar: 8g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftover Instapot Sausage and Peppers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat in the microwave or on the stovetop until heated through.
- The flavors tend to develop and intensify over time, making it even more delicious as leftovers.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I use fresh tomatoes instead of canned tomatoes?
   - Yes, you can use fresh tomatoes. Peel and dice about 4-5 medium-sized tomatoes and use them in place of the canned diced tomatoes. You may need to adjust the cooking time slightly to allow for the fresh tomatoes to break down and release their juices.

2. Can I use a slow cooker instead of an Instant Pot?
   - Absolutely! You can adapt this recipe for a slow cooker. Brown the sausages on the stovetop, then transfer them along with the remaining ingredients to a slow cooker. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours, until the sausages are cooked through and the flavors have melded together.

3. Can I freeze Instapot Sausage and Peppers?
   - Yes, you can freeze this dish. Allow it to cool completely, then transfer it to an airtight container or freezer bag. It can be stored in the freezer for up to 3 months. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.
